author: Shawn Knox
title: Elderly man crashes SUV into Regina General Hospital - Regina | Globalnews.ca
text:
February 7, 2017 4:31 pm Elderly man crashes SUV into Regina General Hospital By Shawn Knox Web Producer Global News 
It happened at 10:12 a.m. when the vehicle, driven by an elderly man, ran into a conference room window in the Native Health Services area of the hospital. Jim Chimirri-Russell / Facebook What is this?

Sponsored content is written by Global News' without any editorial influence by the sponsor. If you'd like to learn more... - Listen 
Crews were left scrambling to clean up on Tuesday morning after an SUV crashed into the Regina General Hospital. 
It happened at 10:12 a.m. when the vehicle, driven by an elderly man, ran into a conference room window in the Native Health Services area of the hospital. 
The driver was escorted to the emergency room, but no one else was hurt. 
Native health reopened its doors this afternoon. 
There is no estimate yet on how much damage was caused during the crash. Police are still investigating the incident. Â© 2017 Global News, a division of Corus Entertainment Inc.
